title: My google Pixel4a phone suddenly have no Google contacts anymore
content:
I have a quite common issue where my pixel phone loses sync connection with the Google contacts and I need to do some kind of restore of the contacts on my google account frequently. It's a Google pixel phone and it's a Google contact account do you have an answer to this issue or not?
The same issue occured on my previous Samsung S10.
I have tried in installing, clearing cache and related advices. 
Please do not refere me to a previous thread with those standard suggestions.

Google team must be aware of why this happens.


In short

1/ all names on my recent calls and all my contacts suddenly disappears

2 / I go to my google account and find that I have no contavys at all any more

3/ I do a restore from contacts to yesterday's status, and now all my contacts show - and my pixel starts to sync again


To me, this seem to be an account issue at the Google cloud environment , rather than s device / OS problem
 But I am not sure.

I the year 2020 google, in control over hardware,OS and cloud must be able to resolve a simple contact sync issue like this?
